_comments.icons: Icon configuration for UI elements. Icon names must match lucide-react component names (PascalCase). See https://lucide.dev/icons/
_comments.icons.navigation: Icons for header navigation elements (menu, search, settings, profile, logout, etc.)
_comments.icons.homepage: Icons for homepage hero section, badges, and CTAs
_comments.icons.about: Icons for about page feature pillars (creators, platform, learners)
_comments.icons.profile: Icons for profile page tabs (user, activity, settings, accounts, content, analytics)
_comments.icons.status: Icons for content status indicators (draft, edit, preview, share, publish)
_comments.icons.actions: Icons for common action buttons (copy, download, externalLink, info)
_comments.icons.error: Icons for error and not-found pages (notFound, serverError, refresh)
_comments.icons.course: Icons for course-related UI elements (pricing, education indicators)
_comments.icons.course.price: Icon for price/cost indicators in drafts and lessons
_comments.icons.course.education: Icon for course/lesson headers and graduation indicators
_comments._overview: Application copy/text configuration - centralizes all user-facing text for easy customization, branding, and localization
_comments._runtime_usage: Loaded by multiple UI components (e.g., header, homepage, content pages). Keep JSON valid; this _comments section documents keys without affecting runtime.
_comments.site: Core site information displayed in page titles, meta tags, and navigation branding
_comments.site.title: Main site title used in browser tab, SEO meta title, and site header
_comments.site.description: Site description used in meta tags for SEO and social sharing
_comments.site.brandName: Brand name displayed in header logo/navigation area
_comments.navigation: Header navigation text including search, menu items, buttons, and accessibility labels
_comments.navigation.searchPlaceholder: Placeholder text shown in the search input field
_comments.navigation.menuItems: Text labels for main navigation menu items (links in the header)
_comments.navigation.menuItems.content: Top-level link to the content library
_comments.navigation.buttons: Text for navigation action buttons (login, signup, etc.)
_comments.navigation.buttons.login: Login button label in the header
_comments.navigation.accessibility: Screen reader accessible labels for interactive elements
_comments.navigation.accessibility.toggleTheme: ARIA label for the theme toggle control
_comments.navigation.accessibility.selectTheme: ARIA label for the theme selection list
_comments.homepage: All text content for the homepage including hero section, stats, CTA, and content sections
_comments.homepage.hero: Hero section text including badge, title lines, animated words, description, and button labels
_comments.homepage.hero.badge: Small label shown above the main headline
_comments.homepage.hero.title.line1: First line of the hero title
_comments.homepage.hero.title.line2: Second line prefix before animated words
_comments.homepage.hero.title.useAnimated: Toggle rotating animated words on/off in the hero title
_comments.homepage.hero.animatedWords: Array of words that cycle through in the animated title portion
_comments.homepage.hero.title.staticWord: Word to display when animation is disabled (defaults to first animatedWords entry)
_comments.homepage.hero.title.line3: Final line of the hero title
_comments.search: Search page hero, tabs, empty/error states, and summary text
_comments.verifyEmail: Email verification page titles, labels, errors, and buttons
_comments.about.steps: Three cards under the About page ‚ÄúHow to make it yours‚Äù section
_comments.payments.purchaseDialog: Toasts and statuses for purchase/zap-to-unlock flow
_comments.payments.zapDialog: Toasts and statuses for standalone zap dialog
_comments.homepage.stats: Statistics section displaying platform metrics with values, labels, and optional icons. You can add, remove, or reorder stats here.
_comments.homepage.stats.*.label: Short label describing the metric (e.g., 'Students')
_comments.homepage.stats.*.icon: Optional lucide-react icon component name (e.g., 'Users', 'BookOpen') for the stat. Falls back to a default icon if omitted or invalid.
_comments.homepage.visual: Text overlays and labels for visual elements in the hero section
_comments.homepage.visual.screenLabel: Main label shown inside the hero preview card
_comments.homepage.visual.primaryBadge: Top-right badge text above the hero preview card
_comments.homepage.visual.secondaryBadge: Bottom-left badge text below the hero preview card
_comments.homepage.cta.title: CTA title line
_comments.homepage.cta.buttons.getStarted: Primary CTA in the footer section
_comments.homepage.cta.buttons.viewCourses: Secondary CTA in the footer section
_comments.homepage.cta: Call-to-action section at bottom of homepage with title, description, and buttons
_comments.homepage.sections: Title and description text for content sections (courses, videos, documents)
_comments.subscribe: Subscribe page hero and highlights describing Lightning-powered subscriptions for creators and how learners unlock paid content and perks
_comments.feeds: Feeds page hero and highlights describing Nostr-native community forums plus aggregated feeds from external communities (Discord, Stacker News, other Nostr chats)
_comments.about: About page hero, sections, and call-to-action text describing how this platform works and how to fork it
_comments.about.hero: Hero section for the about page including badge, title, and description
_comments.about.sections: Key pillars that explain who the platform is for and how it works
_comments.about.sections.creators: Section highlighting benefits for creators and communities who fork the platform
_comments.about.sections.learners: Section highlighting benefits for learners who use the platform
_comments.about.sections.platform: Section describing the technical platform (Nostr, Lightning, configuration model)
_comments.about.cta: Footer call-to-action guiding visitors to fork/configure the project
_comments.contentLibrary: Content discovery/library page text including title, filters, empty states
_comments.contentLibrary.resultsCounter: Dynamic text showing results count. Use {count} and {total} placeholders.
_comments.contentLibrary.emptyState: Text shown when no content matches current filters
_comments.course: Course-specific page text including labels, buttons, sidebar information, and metrics
_comments.course.labels: Labels used throughout course pages (course, premium, etc.)
_comments.course.emptyState: Text shown when course has no lessons available
_comments.course.metrics: Labels for course engagement metrics (zaps, comments, likes, etc.)
_comments.resource: Resource (video/document) page text including labels, buttons, and sidebar content
_comments.resource.labels: General labels used on resource pages
_comments.resource.buttons: Action buttons for accessing resource content
_comments.resource.sidebar: Resource information sidebar with metadata labels
_comments.resource.types: Labels for different resource preview types
_comments.contentTypes: Labels for content type classifications (singular and plural forms)
_comments.categories: Content category labels matching the available categories in global config
_comments.status: Status labels for various states (draft, published, enrolled, completed, etc.)
_comments.loading: Loading state text for different contexts and content types
_comments.errors: Error message text for various failure scenarios
_comments.errors.general: Generic error messages with title, description, and retry button text
_comments.emptyStates: Text shown when content sections have no items to display
_comments.notFound: 404 page text including title, description, and navigation buttons
_comments.resourceActions: Action labels for resource interactions (share, resources, premium access)
_comments.contentCards: Text used within content cards including buttons and duration labels
_comments.lessons: Lesson-specific text including numbering, fallback text, and labels

hero.title: Run your own Nostr-native course & content platform
hero.description: pleb.school is a forkable, configuration-driven platform. Swap branding, themes, and relays to launch your own education hub, then deploy it to Vercel or your own infrastructure without rewriting the core architecture.

fork.title: 1. Fork & clone
fork.description: Create your own repository and clone it locally. Keep upstream changes in a branch if you want to stay close to the reference implementation.

configure.title: 2. Configure branding & relays
configure.description: Update config/copy.json, config/content.json, and config/nostr.json to match your brand, navigation, content sections, and relay setup.

deploy.title: 3. Deploy your instance
deploy.description: Point your environment variables at your Postgres instance and Nostr relays, then deploy to Vercel, Fly.io, or your preferred platform.

creators.title: For creators & communities
creators.description: Launch a white-label academy that lives on your domain, with your branding, pricing, and content model. Use the JSON configs under /config to define how courses, documents, and videos are presented.

learners.title: For learners
learners.description: Give your audience a single place to watch talks, follow structured courses, and read long-form content ‚Äî with progress tracking, Lightning-powered interactions, and Nostr identity baked in.

platform.title: For the platform builders
platform.description: Start from a production-ready Next.js 15 stack wired to Prisma, Nostr relays, and Lightning zaps. Swap relays, themes, auth providers, and copy by editing JSON instead of touching business logic.

cta.title: Make this platform your own
cta.description: Fork the repo, point it at your own relays and database, and ship a fully-branded education experience. The reference deployment runs on Vercel, but the stack stays portable.

site.title: pleb.school ‚Äì Nostr-native course & content platform
site.description: Open-source, configurable education stack for creators to run courses, videos, and documents with Nostr identity and Lightning-powered interactions.

hero.description: pleb.school is the reference deployment of a configurable, open source education stack. Fork it, point it at your own relays and database, and run a fully branded Nostr-native course and content platform for your community.

cta.title: Ready to run your own instance?
cta.description: Use this deployment as a sandbox, then fork the repo, customize the configs under /config, and ship a Nostr-native academy that lives on your domain.

courses.title: Courses
courses.description: Opinionated course layouts you can reuse for your own curriculum, from intro concepts to advanced protocol deep dives.

videos.title: Videos
videos.description: Video-first lessons and workshops that show how talks, screencasts, and live sessions can plug into the platform.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Long-form documents and reference notes rendered from markdown and Nostr events.

search.title: Search Content
search.description: Search courses and resources from Nostr relays
search.emptyPrompt: Please enter at least 3 characters to search
search.error: Failed to search. Please try again.

verifyEmail.title: Verify Your Email
verifyEmail.description: Enter the 6-digit code we sent to confirm your email.

errors.tokenExpired: Verification code expired. Request a new one.
errors.tokenMismatch: Code does not match. Try again.

meta.title: Subscribe
meta.description: Soon, creators will be able to accept Lightning-powered subscriptions and give learners access to paid courses, resources, and exclusive community perks.

hero.title: Lightning subscriptions for pleb.school
hero.description: Soon you'll be able to offer paid memberships that unlock premium content on your pleb.school instance ‚Äî using either pay-as-you-go invoices or recurring Lightning subscriptions powered by Nostr Wallet Connect.

signal.title: Pay-as-you-go access
signal.description: Prompt learners to pay a Lightning invoice one month at a time. No cards, no custodians ‚Äî just sats for access.

creators.title: Recurring Lightning subscriptions
creators.description: Use Nostr Wallet Connect to let fans set up recurring Lightning subscriptions that renew automatically from their own wallet.

perks.title: Unlock paid content & perks
perks.description: Subscribed users get access to all paid courses and content you mark as premium, plus future member-only benefits you configure on your instance.

meta.title: Feeds
meta.description: Soon you‚Äôll be able to host a Nostr-native community forum on your pleb.school instance and aggregate read-only feeds from your other spaces like Discord and Stacker News.

hero.title: Coming soon: Nostr-native community feeds
hero.description: Run a Nostr-powered forum directly on your pleb.school deployment while conversations still live on Nostr. Mirror threads from your relays and pull in read-only activity from Discord servers, Stacker News Territories, and other Nostr communities.

sources.title: Host your Nostr forum
sources.description: Create a Nostr-native community board right inside your learning platform‚Äîthreads, replies, and reactions live on Nostr but render alongside your courses.

alerts.title: Bring in your other communities
alerts.description: Pull read-only feeds from existing Nostr chats and group conversations, Discord servers, and Stacker News Territories so learners can follow the wider conversation.

adaptive.title: One home for your people
adaptive.description: Give your community a single hub for lessons, announcements, and discussion while everything remains portable, open, and permissionless on Nostr.

contentLibrary.title: Content Library
contentLibrary.description: Discover courses, videos, and documents for Bitcoin, Lightning, and Nostr development

emptyState.title: No content found
emptyState.description: Try adjusting your filters to see more content

emptyState.lessons: Course lessons will be available soon. Check back later for updated content.

labels.readyToDive: Ready to dive into the content?
labels.clickToAccess: Click below to access the full resource content.

sidebar.author: Author
sidebar.relatedContent: More resources from the same category and difficulty level coming soon.

general.title: Something went wrong
general.description: An error occurred while loading this page. Please try again.

emptyStates.courses: No courses available at the moment.
emptyStates.videos: No video resources available at the moment.
emptyStates.documents: No document resources available at the moment.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: Sorry, we couldn't find the page you're looking for.
